[h1][b]The[/b] hidden gem for noobs and professional players alike. Period.[/h1]
[hr][/hr]
This game mostly gets overlooked at by the majority of today's players, but it really deserves a second glance. [i]Counter Strike: Source[/i] is a Source port of the classic [i]Counter Strike[/i] mod for [i]Half Life[/i], and while it feels just like that, it isn't necessarily a bad thing. The graphics still seem up to snuff, even for today's standards in my regard. Since it's a Source game, it will run as well as [i]Half-Life 2[/i] can run on devices, by which I mean that it can run perfectly at at least 60 fps on any potato from the last 13 years to a brand new PC build sporting the latest and greatest GPU.

If the outdated graphics break it for ya, let the gameplay speak for itself. In my experience CS:S's gameplay feels more smoother than that of [i]Counter Strike: Global Offensive[/i]'s, and my gaming laptop is perfectly capable of running CS:GO without any hiccups. Since there aren't as many people playing CS:S compared to CS:GO you also don't have to deal way less with annoying players.

The gameplay really has led me to believe that Counter Strike: Source is excellent for gamers that are new to the Counter Strike franchise. I can tell from experience. While I am still quite the noob as I'm writing this review, my skill in playing Counter Strike has majorly improved compared to prior buying this game. 


[h3]So, I cannot recommend hard enough that if you're new to Counter Strike or if you're gaming on a budget that Counter Strike: Source is a definite must buy.[/h3]
